caption: This was before COVID-19.  Our visit was on December 6, 2019.  Sadly,  they are temporarily closed.  Had a wonderful lunch at The Albert restaurant.  It is located on the ground floor of the EMC2 hotel.  An intimate space The decor is very interesting, an ecclectic mix.  There are authentic vintage library items such as thousands of books, bookshelves, even the car deck system from old libraries.  It's a gorgeous space that reeks of old-time class.  As others have mentioned, the service was slow even being on a weekday where there were only six other patrons  We had the Smoked Sturgeon (auguachile, fennel and cucumber) and the Skirt Steak with a sunny side egg & tomato hollandaise.  Both items were delicious and I would not hesitate to go back here again once they reopen.
I love the scenery, low key and beautiful! Not a fan of the beef but everything else was fresh and delicious. Great customer service also.
Excellent urban centric environment and great service

We went for the inventor‘s month menu w/o the wine paring and got a super delicious 7 course dinner experience. The cocktails were amazing, too. All in all a great night. It was a bit chilly inside so better go for a sweater then a fancy top or dress. ;)

My review is for the breakfast. Spanish chorizo eggs Benedict.  Chorizo tasted like it was from a local grocery store, the poached eggs were almost hard boiled (why do so many restaurants have such a hard time with poached eggs??) and the muffin was thinner than an amazon cardboard box. I wouldn’t have paid more than $8 for that meal but ended up paying $20 just for the Benedict.
Great food!

The Albert was outstanding. The atmosphere, the service, the drinks and the food were incredible.  After a tough decision I started with the Call Your Mother cocktail. It was a fiery, boozy martini... amazing! I was really craving some carbs so we started with the bread and butter. It is a delicious small loaf of bread right out of the oven. We quickly moved onto the poached foie gras. I've never had it prepared poached before so it was interesting to try it that way. The charred octopus was phenomenal. There was a lot more octopus than I was expecting the flavors were unique and delicious.  We then split the rabbit and duck and were very impressed with everything. Both meats were very tender and juicy but very different flavors. I was too full to try and of the desserts but I look forward to coming back and trying some.  It was a pricey meal but you get what you pay for. Or just go for a drink and enjoy the amazing space. I will definitely be back again!
Food was fabulous....valet parking sucked....waited 1 hour for our car!

We dined tonight and tried the chef prepared menu for Valentine’s Day 2020. Everything was phenomenal from the food to the energy, service, music - it was all good. Our server was wonderful! While she was assisting other tables, the manager went to get our bill (my date prepaid for dinner because he didn’t want me knowing the total. I appreciated this gesture because I didn’t want to know the cost of the meal and be worried about how much was spent on me.. )  So instead of worrying I get to be treated today, so we hoped. Unfortunately, for some reason when she (the manager working tonight) brought us our check, she announced the $228 prepaid total and then announced the additional cost of drinks... it really took away from the special feeling of being treated. It was also just a bit tacky. Most people know, when you buy someone an expensive (or even not expensive) gift, you don’t leave the price tag on.. just like you don’t read the bill aloud to the table.  The people sitting next to us even said something, because they had the same prepared meal and he didn’t want his date to know either. I tried to catch her before leaving to politely let her know this instead of writing this on a review, but maybe she noticed we were disappointed and avoided us .. she instead sent the waiter back after she took away from the wonderful dining experience the waiter worked so hard to create. it felt tacky and careless.. it’s also just not nice to do to your waiters.  Regardless of the last min hiccup of the night from the manager... everything else was wonderful and we will be back. And if that dining experience ends better, than I will be happy to add the additional star. The menu is extremely creative and I have to say, the dishes prepared for each zodiac sign was so unique and spot on to my date’s and my tastes. We hope to find the Buffalo Carpaccio and the Coal Roasted  Beef on the menu again!!!  Update:  Thank you for the response, Aislyn! I really appreciate you taking the time on such a busy night to. I also appreciate you clarifying that you were just pulled away, because we waiting a min at the front. I wasn’t upset or concerned at all by the prepayment or which menu was which.. just the announcement of the cost of the meal at the table. I just wasn’t suppose to know how much everything was. We also are use to a bill being set down and leaving us to ask for help if we Feel we need it.  Also, the server was Kelli and briefly man who ran food, mostly Kelli. She was very engaging and thorough while moving very fast to so many tables.

This cute restaurant is in the hotel I have stayed at over the past two years and I never enjoyed it until this time. Always running around to other places being disappointed until my most recent trip. I booked reservations for lunches and dinners in advance this time but did not have an opening for this restaurant in my schedule, or so I thought. After a day of travel I just wanted to check-in, eat dinner, and relax. I booked my party a reservation at a seafood restaurant close by and was excited to try the place. I would use the word unfortunately but it was worse than that word implies. The restaurant I had reservations at said they could not seat us even though tables were empty. It was ok because we were early but took a turn to the worst when a couple came in and the man  asked (they knew each other and tried to come to an arrangement without anyone else hearing) this fat old man at the host station if there were any open tables cause they're a walk-in (meaning: no reservations). The fat old man and vapid women at the host station knew the couple and gave these two individuals a large four person table. I was filled with disgust witnessing happen right in front of my party. We abruptly walked out and were followed by one of the moron hostesses cause they were worried we would give them a bad review. I knew what I was going to do. I was headed back to my hotel with The Albert in it to try and have a good meal. My group throughly enjoyed ourselves at The Albert and laughed at ourselves for trying that pretentious derivative seafood joint. Thank you Albert.
Great food presentation, mixture of tastes, perfectly cooked octopus, great drinks

I was staying at the EMC2 hotel and was on a time crunch so I came downstairs and had lunch here! Not a lot of people were here on Saturday at around 1:30pm. I got the purple gnocchi which was very rich and delicious!  They have a lot of "different" and unique items on the menu which was awesome. My dish was around $20!! Not bad for a hotel restaurant.
Quite and very nice place. Amazing food and friendly atmosphere!
Went for cocktails, good drinks and nice atmosphere.
Amazing food and ambience. We loved the cauliflower soup and the gnocci. Highly recommend.
Unique drinks.  Delicious desserts.  Excellent service.
Absolutely outstanding food and service. The drink menu is also out of this world!

Very disappointed after 95$ per head Christmas Day dinner. Food was fine but we were denied more rolls (only 1 tiny roll per person as they were running out at 6:30p seating) and more dessert and had to ask for more turkey, mashed potatoes and prime rib as what had been allotted for the table of 4 (normal weight) adults was definitely not enough. We asked for ice cream and were then told that they had “run out.” Service was poor and understaffed. Also had to request that we not be sat at a high top table for the meal. Absolutely do not recommend and will not return.
Good drinks..but a bit overpriced and limited regarding food.
Great restaurant and really cool.vibe. great drinks, small portions of good, coolest bathroom
Cool place
Plates are extremly small. Service good. Robots are cool in the hotel. But the food is very ordinary.
Great tastes.  Good service.  Empty, though. Portion sizes were really really tragically tiny, especially for the price.  After we left, went out for dinner.

Loved the decor and server was very nice.  Food was very eclectic and I enjoyed it. A little heavy on vinegar.  Would have been a solid 4 stars except I had a thumbnail size shell in my crab appetizer.   Would have still been a 4 but they still charged me full price.  A $22 appetizer that had a huge crab shell in it  :(
Easily one of the most creative dinner menus in Chicago! Can’t believe it was just part of the hotel. The atmosphere is creatively modern and rustic. Highly recommended!
This place was absolutely phenomenal. From the drinks to the dessert, nothing was a disappointment! In fact, only wanted seconds! I would highly recommend!
Wonderful, unique, and (most importantly) delicious cocktails paired with dishes that combine uncommon pairings to deliver a wonderful collection of flavors.
Beautiful hotel with a great interactive science centered theme and the Albert restaurant Inside is next level
The food and the entire experience was great. I had the dragon sushi roll and spicy miso soup. I love how the lighting makes it more intimate setting for u and your partner. Staff was very pleasant.
The place is amazing, but the food, though nicely presented, took forever and it came almost cold.

Amazing food that looks like art.  Absolutely delicious and tender beef with rainbow carrots, parsnip puree, and eggplant.  The amazon dessert with chocolate cake base, mango sorbet center, with meringue that was roasted at the table

Terrible service. Multiple tables waiting for drinks and surrounded by unhappy customers. Wait staff doesn't acknowledge your existence until you wave them down, paired with service with a frown. A shame for such a neat looking bar. They have *serious* operational efficiencies. I would recommend avoiding this place unless you have 40 mins to wait for drinks. This is how long you wait prior to peak hours.
Great food and service. We did the 5 course chef menu and couldn't be happier with what the chef prepared for us.
Excellent food, service and cool ambience
I loved the brunch fixed menu!!! It was delicious! My waitress was awesome too. A beautiful ambiance. I will definitely return!
Cool vibe!!! Going back...
Beautiful place, servers are excellent and the food was delicious...well presented..
Breakfast was delicious. Atmosphere was clean and perfect for instagram worthy photos. Great service. I highly recommend.
Amazing food! Extraordinary service! Definitely a place you should check out!

Beautiful eclectic decor in a cozy atmosphere. The service is one of the best I experienced. Our waiter was knowledgeable and accommodative and was able to answer all questions. We ordered multiple dishes to share and try variety of flavors. Everything we ordered was delicious including unique flavors like foie gras with blueberry cake as shown in posted photo. The crispy chicken leg was juicy yet still perfectly crispy on the outside. Also enjoyed lightly battered mushrooms and their ceviche had a delicious dressing, different than what usually served in other places. Even though this place is not cheap it is one that should be tried.

Came here for a nightcap and enjoyed our visit. We were staying at the EMC2 and wanted to check out the downstairs restaurant on our way back from dinner. The restaurants vibe was really cool and matched the hotel perfectly. Their bar set up was really neat as well so that where we posted up. The bartender was very friendly and gave us great service. Their food menu did look pretty good so we’re going to be dining in the next time we’re in town!
Great place
Amazing food and attentive service. Prices are high for the tapas style menu, but worth it.

It would have been five stars except for the service. We had to give the waitress several reminders for a variety of things like water and beer and silverware), but the food was some of the best I've had in Chicago.
They have a happy hour from 3-5 PM. The bite are good. Prices on the drinks are price at the same prices as the other establishments around the area. I would go back.
We tried the Pre Fixe menu,  best choice ever!! Says 5 courses but I think it was really 8 for less than 100.  Service was great. Highly recommend!
Great place to meet after work for business or an intimate dinner.
Great food and good atmosphere. Are here with a group, and got a large table near the kitchen. Service was timely and food was great. I had the sea bass and sorbet for dessert. Recommended.
Steak was amazing. Excellent wine selection.

The Albert is definitely decorated pretty cool! The plants hanging above the bar is a neat touch! I was there for Mother's Day brunch. The Chilaquiles were very spicy but very soggy. That's why just 4 stars from me. The atmosphere was pretty chill and relaxed. I'd come back again for drinks and dinner.

Excellent menu that changes seasonally. Staff extremely knowledgeable about the menu and bar offerings. The vibe is modern and chic with class. I enjoy staying at EMC2 and highly recommend dining at The Albert.

I was on a business trip and The Albert was recommended to me. It was fantastic. The food was fabulous, as was the ambiance. Our server, Shane, was probably the best part of the entire evening. He was super friendly, funny, and knowledgeable. He truly made our evening. I would highly recommend this place and am excited to return the next time I visit Chicago.
Simply one of the best octopus dishes we've ever had. And the bread and butter was out of this world. And who doesn't love Albert Einstein themed art work and decor. I will definitely be back.
Everything was great

I've had lunch with my wife at the Albert and we had a very pleasant experience. Not only the food was amazing and the decoration is extremely cool, reassembling an old library, but 6 hours later I've noticed I had forgot my wallet there and they quickly confirmed they had it with all the items inside, including some dollar bills. Great food, great decoration, great service and honest people. Highly recommended!

Chef👏🏾Paul👏🏾is👏🏾everything👏🏾. My team held a dinner and he was really cool about letting me ask questions, shared food knowledge, and made us a special dish of a pistachio pesto gnochetti with like some type of cream foam cheesy deliciousness. The dish was light citrusy earthy and delicious. He also has an awesome grey streak in his hair. The atmosphere of the place is cool and drinks were amazingly balanced but he was definitely the best part.
The Albert is a great bar / resturant ... Awesome cocktails...great food ...right next to the EMC2 hotel ..which is amazing and has a robot delivery service.

I went here a couple of weeks ago and had the chefs tasting menu, it was a wonderful experience with powerful flavors. The staff was on top of it all, silent and swift, course explanations rolled off their tongues like food was their first language.  Mood lit space and live acoustic music with modern and high-end finishes, a social media post dream! I Highly recommend going!

Went here for restaurant week, and it was fantastic! They were very accommodating of dietary restrictions and the wine flight that was an option for NOT disappoint - would love to stay in the actual hotel that it’s attached to!
Great happy hour good service and food the olny down side is the small menu

(Translated by Google) Delicious, I would definitely go back. unique dishes with combinations of ingredients with great flavor. Good atmosphere and unsurpassed attention. The kitchen is open so you can see all the preparations. highly recommended  (Original) Delicioso, sin duda volvería.  platillos únicos con combinaciones de ingredientes con gran sabor. Buen ambiente y atención insuperable. La cocina es abierta entonces puedes ver todas las preparaciones. muy recomendable

I had a wonderful and unforgettable fine-dining experience at the Albert. Highly recommend the “Housemade Bread with Cultured Butter” for the starter. I believe that the simplest dish could tell the quality of one restaurant, and the bread was really fresh and delicious. I also think no one should miss the “Poached Foie Gras”, the creative presentation was special, and the taste was unexpectedly good. As for the main, the hangar steak was really delicious as well. I tried the drink Angostura Sour, was very delighting. It mixed gin, lime, and egg white, pretty smooth mouthfeel. Nice ambience, nice music. However, room for improvement was the service, the waiter did not ask about  how we want the steak to be cooked ( thankfully it was medium rare). Also they did not ask about if we want to add salt etc. I hope they could improve next time. Follow instagram @liying_chou
Cool.bar . Good wine . Artistic vibe , robot in the lobby.
Fantastic food. Fine dining. A go-to for special occasions.
Something a little bit different - great happy hour

One of the most interesting restaurant interiors in the city. I would put it at the top 3 (katana and the pump room) the food at lunch was above average. Ambitious but but fell a little short of the mark. Salad was good, the soup was a little cool and thin texture, the tartine and duck confit were a good choiice but the were comprimised in their composition with the bread contributing too much.  I will go back for dinner. Wine by the glass should gave two or three more choices.

I really enjoyed the breakfast muffin with a soft boiled egg that I had, but my dining companion was less impressed with his breakfast- the Albert special. The staff was great. The tea was delicious but overpriced- $9 dollars a pot? But it did come with a pretty teacup.

(Translated by Google) Clean dishes well made feel the ingredients. Celeriac soup and poached scallops! Cocktails very well done I recommend Angostura sour Dessert: secret garden  (Original) Piatti puliti ben fatti si sentono gli ingredienti. Celeriac soup and poached scallops! Cocktail fatti molto bene consiglio Angostura sour Dessert: secret garden
username: Cinzia Canzian - Le Vigne di Alice

caption: Very trendy and vibrant place. Spacious and artfully decorated no doubt about it Lunch menu is limited but sufficient when you are having a quick bite or a drink with friends.
(Translated by Google) Quality alongside service, elegant and delicious strongly recommended  (Original) איכות לצד שירות, אלגנטי וטעים מומלץ בחום
Good experience...
Great service, nice decor. The tasting menu is interesting and worth trying

Enjoyed the Albert's Christmas Eve Prix Fixe -- it was pitch perfect, every course harmonized with the next. The Pinot recommended by our waiter was also ideal -- it was a really lovely evening, and the service was great. Look forward to returning during the year to try their regular menu.

What an awesome hotel. Friendly staff. We picked this hotel because of it's peculiar style as an Autograph hotel. Great location and highly suggested. Where else would a robot bring towels to your room?
Great place for some lovely drinks

Two of us had dinner at The Albert on 11/30 and our waitress (African American with glasses) was upbeat, engaging and knowledgeable. She was  hospitable and accomodating throughout our visit.  There are two salads on the menu so we had one of each and both were great.  I also enjoyed my duck entree and the gin cocktail that was suggested by our waitress.  The only downside was the hostess who was not nearly as pleasant as the rest of the staff.
Excellent food and delicious cocktail

My wife and I came here to celebrate our anniversary. The staff, the food, the atmosphere, everything was unbelievably good. We found ourselves staring a lot of the time because there is just so much to look at. We had the grand board, the baby octopus, and the hangar steak. All of which I would recommend. The 2 desserts (yes, 2!) were both excellent although Notorious GBM won for appearances only. The quince ice cream is....unique, but actually works quite well with the gingerbread. My wife and I will definitely be back!

Such a great experience! Our server Connor was so passionate. The way he described each dish was in such detail. He described flavors and textures to the point where we almost wanted to ask about more dishes just to hear his descriptions. Ask for Conner, amazing. We started with the Venison carpaccio which was just as beautiful as it was delicious. I had the Scallops in lemon grass fomage. It had a light citrus flavor and was mouthwatering. My friend had the duck breast which was so succulent with just right right amount of crunch on the skin. For dessert we shared the apple tart with rosemary mousse and a toasted cheese cracker. So unique and so good. Albert's was a great experience, I highly recommend it.
Food was incredible but the service was better. I sat at the bar and the staff was super welcoming and just social enough that I didn't get bored but enjoyed my "me" time.
Great! Will definitely be returning again. The area is terrific for me.
Delicious, if slightly oversaturated flavors.  Nice cocktails, inspired desserts.  Great vibe and atmosphere.

What an incredible night. We were here when they first opened and it was very very good. But over a year later, the excellent development of staff and menu was obvious. The food was more approachable, but amazing, every dish. Service was gracious, attentive, knowledgeable and good humored. Can't wait to go back!!

The Albert has great food, service, and a friendly staff. Every dish we tried was unique, but also had some familiar touches which made the fine dining experience very accessible. I recommend trying the fried mushrooms and octopus with white barbecue sauce, but everything on on menu was fantastic so you can’t go wrong with anything you chose.

This place is impressive.  It’s a candidate for all the accolades a restaurant could want.  However, something is off.  I can’t put my finger on it.  The food was beautifully presented but lacked the punch to your palette or the subtle delight you expect from this price point.   I would pass.
(Translated by Google) The library's ticky atmosphere calmed down, it was delicious.  (Original) 図書館チックな雰囲気が落ち着く、美味しかった。

All our food was delicious but the The Secret Garden dessert was simply amazing! Both visuals and taste were on point. Drivers (non-alcoholic) cocktails here are also very good. The staff was friendly and attentive. It was a very pleasant brunch experience! Definitely will be back to try more desserts :)
Very hip and vibrant place. Spacious and artfully decorated. Lunch menu is limited but sufficient when you are having a quick bite or a drink with friends.
Crazy Good Food. I can convey that this restaurant is acceptable.
We had the tasting menu and words can't describe how incredible it was.  Absolutely amazing.

This restaurant is a perfect companion to the EMC2 hotel, which is itself a great and quirky (in a good way) place to stay. I had drinks, apps, and entrees at Albert. The bartenders were knowledgable about the food, and engaged me in conversations about the entrees, flavor elements they liked and did not, and what recommendations to make based on my expressed preferences. I really enjoyed my meal. I will easily be staying at the hotel again and eating at this restaurant.
We only came for drinks, but the place had a nice vibe, we took a peek at the menu and it made us want to come for dinner next time. Drinks were inventive bit not overly so, and excellent.
Great service. Tasty drinks. Amazing food. The chef came to our table. I recommend and I will return.
They have a pastry chef. GO!

excellent option for drinks/dining/snacking if you are in the area. order the bread! octopus dish was slightly over charred but it was on a bed of delicious yogurt seasoned rice and shishito peppers. there is a small patio if interested in outdoor seating. the indoor decor is classy.

Just very surprised by the quality of the meals i ate on Monday night with my friend. I disn t expect that from an hotel-restaurant. A big five for the delicious meals and the nice and kind service we had. Will come again for sure!
Great cocktails, great service. Sarah (with an "H" ) was amazing!

Outstanding and Artful -- I was delighted by every part of my dinner tonight.  The service is attentive yet cozy, the dishes were artfully plated both visually and in terms of flavors and textures, and the interior design is wildly interesting without being invasive.  The dinner was really incredible and surpassed expectations.  My glass of Willamette Valley Pinot Noir was perfection as well.  I am staying at the hotel as well which is utterly unique in many ways.  Bravo to Marriott/Starwood on this one!
Place looks nice, interier is interesting, but service was really slow, it took about 25 minutes to make order, though only half of tables were occupied.
Great drinks and friendly bar staff.
Really enjoyed my visit, excellent drinks.
Great cocktails.. Didn't eat but a very cool bar and restaurant
Cute bar and library area. Nice cocktails and snack options at the bar
Love the vibe and the service.
Best meal in Chicago! Great specialty cocktails

Loved it! The food was great and the atmosphere and the music playlist was definitely what I was looking for. The best part was that it was right next door to my hotel. Sooo convenient. I will definitely go back there again when I go back to Chicago.
Great ambiance and decor. Pricier drinks.

Perfect restaurant matched into the unique ambiance of Hotel EMC2, perfectly reflecting their claim to be “restlessly curious and unconventional.” The Albert is a nice, little restaurant in Hotel EMC2 for daily dining or for a get-together at the bar. Enter through the main EMC2 entrance for seating by an attentive host staff—reservations recommended as this small restaurant can get very busy at prime times. The tables provide configurations for parties of various sizes and include heavy, comfortable chairs and upholstered couch-style seating. The ambiance is dim and hip with up-beat music, fanciful art, and a mix of bookcase décor, including the big wall of books, that really just feels fresh, fun, and a little romantic. Serving and bar staff is busy but seems a bit overwhelmed at times. The bar is small but nice and perfect for small get togethers. The drink menu is interesting and inventive. The drink Her Name was Vivian (vodka, lemon, egg white, violette) was tasty and foamy. The drink Don’t Tell Your Mother was a strong martini with spicy and mescal laced hints (if you like mescal and martini’s, get this one). The dinner menu is not large but is interesting with a variety and inventiveness that makes decisions difficult. The quality of the food shows the kitchen is staffed with very skilled professionals. Definitely get the Housemade Breads with Cultured Butter—great variety of breads and good butter. I did not like the General Tso’s Spiced Nuts—very nice presentation but the cooked coating on the nuts was just too bitter to really enjoy. The Saffron Pressed Melon, Quinoa and Cashew Butter was simply incredible—get this appetizer! The Colorado Lamb Shoulder with Black Garlic and Lentils was dark, heavy, and deep—get this dish if you’re feeling like something that’s excessively meaty and rich. The Fjord Sea Trout Dill, Golden Beets and Creme Fraiche is overwhelmingly good with crispy skin, luscious fish, and one of the tastiest fish dressings I’ve ever encountered. The Southern Fried Goodness (Bread Pudding Doughnut, Vanilla Anglaise, Brown Butter) was absolutely delightful and fit perfectly with a strong espresso. The prices are good; overall, I rate this restaurant as a good value for great location, bustling staff, great ambiance, inventive menu, good food, and good price. Recommended for a nice evening for couples in downtown Chicago.
nice place for a drink and small food
Delicious and quality...

Food was good. Creative & Tasty & Pretty to look at.  Interior was nice to look at. What was disappointing was the service. Front of the house.... *missing* Mmm...not a good impression.  Other people who came after us, same thing...they waited and waited. We looked around too to see if we can get attention of one of the staffs to service them. Nobody around! Understaffed. We finished our meal and we waited for a while before we got the dessert menu. Then after dessert... our table is clear. Our drinks are empty. Waiting for the check now *tik tok tik tok*.... come on~~  For the price they charge, they need to better their service. They need more staff on the floor.

This place is impeccable. Great service and ambiance. Heinrich and Sarah really know their product  and were able to provide a great recommendation for me. The raspberry/lemon waffle is a 10/10, especially paired with the Irish coffee.
Waiter was good.  Food was excellent.
Cozy place, good acoustics, friendly knowledgeable staff and inventive food.

I wouldn't really know too much about the place. The service was so bad upon arrival that we never made it to the food. No hostess at the desk for quite awhile, no server until after another table (who was seated nearly 10 after us) was seated AND given water, had the menu explained, and their order placed. Plus, attitude from our server, we never got her name, was that we had done something wrong by asking her who our server was. No worries, we had a great Christmas dinner elsewhere and won't be returning. I liked all the books on the wall... The only reason for two stars.

I give restaurants 3 opportunities to impress me. Dined here three times and all 3 had same theme - oversalted food coupled with awkward and poorly timed service. Not a fan of the restaurant but a big fan of the hotel. Hopefully they will work out the kinks and escalate to where they can be.

Had high hopes. Starters were great. Wait staff was very sub par. Very inattentive and awkward. The place was half full and we were forced into an awkward corner seat. Sunchokes were great, but small as you can see. The kitchen staff was great and very knowledgeable.
Beautiful

I can't say enough good things about my experience at The Albert. Great and creative food, wine, and service. Smallish portions so plan to get three courses. The grilled octopus appetizer was to die for. I will return whenever in Chicago.

This brunch was an unexpected highlight. Managed to put creative and delicious twists on recognizable classics. Avoid tourist-y, boring chain-American food and brunch crowds in a chic setting that is hidden in plain sight with this little gem in the middle of Streeterville.
Stellar cocktails. The setting is impressive

Eclectic interior decor with a copious collection of books and shelves. Their dinner menu highlights the chef's creative dishes with excellent flavor profiles. Let's take the Spanish Octopus for instance. The grilled octopus coated with quinoa adds more pebbled texture, complimented with tahini yogurt, avocado purée, cilantro and mint leaves.

Came for lunch with a co-worker, had the octopus, campanelle house made pasta, and chicken sandwich. Wow. Can't wait to come back to taste Brandon Brumback flex on the Streeterville dining scene. Menu was simple and perfect, presentation was exceptional for lunch service. On top of the delicious meal we had the ambience was on 10. As much as I selfishly want to keep for myself- excited for more people to find out about this new hidden gem

We visited for dinner on a Saturday evening. It wasn't too busy when we arrived around 7p but reservations are recommended as it was filled by 7:30p. Service was excellent, the waiter was attentive and able to answer all of our questions. The signature cocktail list is limited, mostly gin, however they made a solid manhattan. The food was spectacular. We enjoyed every dish. We went in expecting small portions but we were pleasantly surprised that while they aren't large portions, we didn't leave hungry. Overall a great experience, we will definitely be back.

Started out with a bloody Mary Albert style with pepper infused vodka.  Went in today for an early lunch and love the atmosphere, food, and drinks. shout out to Pierce Buckman in addition to rest of staff as he is a Childhood friend and inspiration to me. We enjoyed the cold corn soup lots of different nuances of flavor in this one and the Spanish octupus had a wonderful array of textures and of course the melon was a perfect pairing. Campanelle is what I knew we would order before coming as I was extremely excited to try the extracted pasta. This did not dissapoint. The acidity brought on by the preserved meyer lemon was perfection. duck Confit was another dish that like the octupus showcased a wide variety of texture! crunchy on the outside melt in your mouth on the inside.  well done, will definitely be back.
Delightful evening, from the ambience to dessert. The dinner was amazing. Desserts were exquisite.
Amazing food also awesome interior. The chefs are doing it right there, a must go!

(Translated by Google) Modern and very pleasant place with the desired decoration (even if a little agreed). Modern and interesting cuisine, good meats, sumptuous desserts. Nice wine list (a little expensive). Small flat: the accompaniments not at the level.  (Original) Lieu moderne et très agréable à la déco recherchée (même si un peu convenue). Cuisine moderne et intéressant, bonnes viandes, desserts somptueux. Jolie carte de vins (un peu chers). Petit bemol: les accompagnements pas au niveau.
Really love being at the Albert! The food, atmosphere and service are all outstanding! Definitely one of the best new restaurants in Chicago.
